content.question: A botanist created a linear model to predict plant height from soil acidity (<math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> level) for a certain type of plant. The slope of the model was 2.5 centimeters per <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> level, the standard deviation of the sample of plant heights was 4 centimeters, and the standard deviation of the soil acidities was 1 <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> level. What is the value of the correlation coefficient?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
